title: score_genes_cell_cycle_scanpy
description:
Calculates the score associated to S phase and G2M phase and annotates the cell cycle phase for each cell, as implemented by scanpy. 
The score is the average expression of a set of genes subtracted with the average expression of a reference set of genes.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input_file.h5mu`. Input h5mu file
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input_file.h5mu`. Input h5mu file

input_layer.description: Type: `string`, example: `log_normalized`. The layer of the adata object containing normalized expression values
input_layer.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `log_normalized`. The layer of the adata object containing normalized expression values.
If not provided, the X attribute of the adata object will be used.

var_gene_names.description: Type: `string`, example: `gene_names`. The name of the column in the var attribute of the adata object that contains the gene names (symbols)
var_gene_names.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gene_names`. The name of the column in the var attribute of the adata object that contains the gene names (symbols).
If not provided, the index of the var attribute will be used.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output_file.h5mu`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output_file.h5mu`. Output h5mu file

obs_phase.description: Type: `string`, default: `phase`. The name of the column in the obs attribute of the adata object that will store the cell cycle phase annotation
obs_phase.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `phase`. The name of the column in the obs attribute of the adata object that will store the cell cycle phase annotation.

obs_s_score.description: Type: `string`, default: `S_score`. The name of the column in the obs attribute of the adata object that will store the s phase score
obs_s_score.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `S_score`. The name of the column in the obs attribute of the adata object that will store the s phase score.

obs_g2m_score.description: Type: `string`, default: `G2M_score`. The name of the column in the obs attribute of the adata object that will store the g2m phase score
obs_g2m_score.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `G2M_score`. The name of the column in the obs attribute of the adata object that will store the g2m phase score.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects
output_compression.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects.
By default no compression is applied.

n_bins.description: Type: `integer`, default: `25`. Number of expression level bins for sampling
n_bins.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `25`. Number of expression level bins for sampling.

random_state.description: Type: `integer`, default: `0`. The random seed for sampling
random_state.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `0`. The random seed for sampling.

allow_missing_genes.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. If true, missing genes in the gene list will be ignored
allow_missing_genes.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. If true, missing genes in the gene list will be ignored.

gene list inputs.title: Gene list inputs
gene list inputs.description:
The gene list inputs can be provided as a list of gene symbols or as a file containing a list of gene symbols. The gene list file should be formatted as a single column with gene symbols.

Make sure that the gene list inputs are consistent with the gene names in the adata object as provided by the --var_gene_names argument.

s_genes.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene1;gene2;gene3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. List of gene symbols for scoring s phase genes
s_genes.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene1;gene2;gene3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. List of gene symbols for scoring s phase genes.

s_genes_file.help_text:
Type: `file`, example: `s_gene_list.txt`. Path to a .txt file containing the gene list of s phase genes to be scored. 
The gene list file should be formatted as a single column with gene symbols.

g2m_genes.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene1;gene2;gene3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. List of gene symbols for scoring g2m phase genes
g2m_genes.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene1;gene2;gene3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. List of gene symbols for scoring g2m phase genes.

g2m_genes_file.help_text:
Type: `file`, example: `g2m_gene_list.txt`. Path to a .txt file containing the gene list of g2m phase genes to be scored. 
The gene list file should be formatted as a single column with gene symbols.

gene_pool.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene1;gene2;gene3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. List of gene symbols for sampling the reference set
gene_pool.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene1;gene2;gene3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. List of gene symbols for sampling the reference set. Default is all genes.

gene_pool_file.description: Type: `file`, example: `gene_pool.txt`. File with genes for sampling the reference set
gene_pool_file.help_text:
Type: `file`, example: `gene_pool.txt`. File with genes for sampling the reference set. Default is all genes. 
The gene pool file should be formatted as a single column with gene symbols.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
